```{r load_libary, include=FALSE}
library(ggplot2)
library(readxl)
library(tidyverse)
library(lubridate)
library(data.table)
library(stringr)
```
Choose what site you want to create yield potential for.


```{r list of files in directory}
  list_of_file <- list.files(
    (file.path("H:","Output-2", "Analysis", "Scripts", "Jackie", "Decile_tables"), pattern = "GS_decile_table.csv")
  
 
```

```{r sites_selction_download file}
  df <- read.csv(paste0(file.path("H:","Output-2", "Analysis", "Scripts", "Jackie", "Decile_tables"), 
         "/GS_decile_table_",
         input$site_number, 
         ".csv")) 
```

## Including Plots

You can also embed plots, for example:

```{r pressure, echo=FALSE}
plot(pressure)
```

Note that the `echo = FALSE` parameter was added to the code chunk to prevent printing of the R code that generated the plot.
